transcript.title: Easter 2018
transcript.content:
Easter is the most important time in the Christian calendar - bringing hope, new life and renewal.

For many of us, regardless of our faith, Easter is an opportunity to spend time with family and friends.

If you are travelling over the long weekend - please drive carefully, don’t speed, take a break at least every two hours - be safe.

Jesus’ example of love, sacrifice and service to others is one that inspires us all and a reminder that Easter is also a time to remember those in need - the less fortunate, the homeless, the lonely, and the sick.

This long weekend is also a time to thank those who don’t get a break - including our  police, doctors, nurses and firefighters.

I want to pay special tribute to our emergency service workers who have supported our resilient and courageous communities in the Northern Territory,  QLD, Victoria and NSW - where cyclones, floods and fires have done their worst.

Finally, we should also remember those who are far from home this Easter including our Defence Force servicemen and women. .

So over this Easter holiday, Lucy and I hope you have a safe, peaceful and inspiring holiday, shared with the people you love.
